org.instantplaces.purewidgets.client.widgets.feedback
Class FeedbackSequencer

java.lang.Object
  org.instantplaces.purewidgets.client.widgets.feedback.FeedbackSequencer

public class FeedbackSequencer
extends java.lang.Object

The FeedbackSequencer sequences the showing and hiding of the input feedback panel for the widget. The sequence has the following states: <- <- <- <- <- <- | | \/ | STOPPED -> SHOWING(delay) -> [More feedback to display?](yes) -> INTERVAL(delay) /\ (no) | | | \/ <- <- <- <- <- <- FINAL(delay) STOPPED (not showing any input feedback and there is no feedback to show) -> (when feedback is received) SHOWING (the panel is showing feedback) -> (after the duration period passed) INTERVAL (the panel is temporarily hidden, if there is more feedback to show) | FINAL (the panel stays visible, if there is no more feedback to show)

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

protected static class FeedbackSequencer.STATE
          The states of the sequencer.
 
Field Summary
private  InputFeedback current
          The current input feedback being processed
static int DEFAULT_FEEDBACK_DELAY
          Multiple input feedback will be shown with intervals of DEFAULT_FEEDBACK_DELAY milliseconds.
static int DEFAULT_FEEDBACK_DURATION
          The internal input feedback will be shown for DEFAULT_FEEDBACK_DURATION milliseconds.
static int DEFAULT_FINAL_DELAY
          If there is no more feedback to show, the panel will stay visible during DEFAULT_FINAL_DELAY milliseconds, be default.
private  FeedbackDisplay display
          The display panel for the input feedback.
private  int feedbackDuration
          The duration of each feedback on the display
private  int feedbackFinalDelay
          The amount of time the panel will stay visible after the last feedback is shown.
private  int feedbackIntervalDelay
          The interval between multiple feedbacks
protected  java.util.List<InputFeedback> input
          The list of input feedback to display.

          The listener for events regarding the input feedback.
protected  FeedbackSequencer.STATE state
          the current state.
protected  com.google.gwt.user.client.Timer timer
          The timer used to implement the sequencer.

Method Detail

isShowing

public boolean isShowing()

add

public void add(InputFeedback feedback)

start

private void start()
Starts the sequencing of feedback display, if necessary. If the sequencer is in the STOPPED or FINAL states (in which case the timer will not be triggered again), this method cancels the timer and starts the sequencing again.

timerElapsed

private void timerElapsed()
The timerElapsed() implements the transitioning between the sequencer states. This method is called when the timer elapses.

stopShowingFeedback

private void stopShowingFeedback()
This method stops showing the current feedback by hiding its display.

startShowingFeedback

private void startShowingFeedback()
This methods starts showing the current feedback by showing its display.
